Description: A Release Train Engineer (RTE) is a key leadership role in Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) for enterprises. The RTE is responsible for the successful delivery of value from a particular Agile Release Train (ART), acting as a servant leader, coach, and facilitator for the ART. The RTE's role is to ensure that the ART follows the SAFe processes and principles, coordinates with other ARTs, and stays aligned with the overall business objectives. The RTE also helps identify and mitigate program-level impediments and dependencies, manages risks, and ensures the smooth flow of communication within the ART and with other stakeholders. The RTE is a critical contributor to the success of the organization's Agile transformation and delivery of value to the customers.

Required.SkillDescription: Strong understanding of Agile and SAFe methodologies and experience in implementing and managing these practices at the enterprise level

Required.SkillName: Agile Release Train Planning and Execution
Required.SkillDescription: Experience in Agile Release Train planning and execution, and the ability to manage multiple teams and stakeholders within the ART
Ability to facilitate meetings and workshops, and to coach team members on Agile and SAFe practices and principles
Ability to build and lead high-performing Agile teams, and to foster a culture of collaboration, continuous improvement, and transparency
Ability to identify and solve problems, and to resolve conflicts within the Agile Release Train and across the enterprise
Ability to identify areas for improvement and to facilitate continuous improvement at the Agile Release Train and enterprise levels

Recommended.SkillDescription: Certification in SAFe methodologies, such as SAFe Agilist (SA), SAFe Program Consultant (SPC), or SAFe Release Train Engineer (RTE)
Experience in Lean-Agile leadership, including the ability to drive organizational change and to build a Lean-Agile culture
Experience in project management, and the ability to apply project management principles and techniques within the Agile and SAFe context
Understanding of business concepts and the ability to align Agile and SAFe practices with business objectives and priorities
Understanding of technical concepts and the ability to communicate effectively with technical team members and stakeholders
Understanding of risk management principles and techniques, and the ability to identify and mitigate potential risks associated with Agile Release Train and portfolio operations
Ability to analyze data and metrics related to the Agile Release Train and the enterprise, and to use this information to improve team performance and business outcomes
Understanding of DevOps practices and their integration with Agile and SAFe practices, and the ability to work effectively with DevOps teams
Understanding of Big Data technologies and the ability to apply Agile and SAFe practices to Big Data projects
Knowledge of artificial intelligence (AI) techniques and the ability to apply these techniques to improve team performance and business outcomes
Understanding of Internet of Things (IoT) technologies and the ability to apply Agile and SAFe practices to IoT projects
Understanding of User Experience (UX) design principles and the ability to work effectively with UX designers to improve the user experience of Agile and SAFe products and applications
Understanding of data science concepts and the ability to work effectively with data scientists to improve the data-driven decision-making of Agile and SAFe teams and stakeholders
Experience in implementing SAFe at the enterprise level, and the ability to customize and tailor SAFe practices to the specific needs and context of the organization
Experience in managing vendors and external partners, and the ability to ensure that vendors and partners adhere to Agile and SAFe practices and standards
Understanding of program management principles and techniques, and the ability to manage large-scale programs and initiatives within the SAFe context
Understanding of release management principles and techniques, and the ability to manage the release of Agile and SAFe products and applications across multiple environments
